comment: :ptv-sleepy:
'Mornin'
Man, indecision is a beeyotch
Hiya Nodle
Noodle
Still on a hunt?
Wrestling with inner demons on requesting reduced hours :P
If you need them, I'd say go for it
But I know the indecision
(THough, thankfully, not yet at my job)
I'm just frustrated with the amount of stuff that isn't in working order :/
I see
Well, I took that exam of mine yesterday, and I've been told to relax.
So now I'm drawing my Halo Fireteam
:ctwokinds-kingtea:
So, on my list of new complaints
We have signs for "Every day low price" bs.  Generally it's some kind of buy 2 discount.  None of those ring up ever
Almost NONE of the gas pumps can actually print a receipt
I take it your management are still not as desired,
Oh, manager's fine.  He's still learning.  But corporate still being corporate and whatnot
That's what I meant, sorry
Corporate
Tbh, I feel sorry for any manager we get
Corporate mandates that managers are scheduled for 48 hours a week, minimum
Ouch.
And maximum?
W/e the store needs, they're salaried at 48k a year
W/e?
whatever
Oh
Well at least they have a somewhat decent wage for all they must go through...
But from a cashier standpoint
But it would be a lot nicer for you if Corporate actually didn't just look for Dollar Signs
Because you must have it very low
I'm just fed up with stuff not working proably
properly*
And it can't be repaired?
Oh, it probably can, but good luck getting it done
Those are literally my only requests
Make sure specials fucking ring up, and that if something isn't working properly, FIX IT
I'm tired of having to remember, "Oh yeah, these popular items are on sale this month"
Whoof
I shouldn't HAVE to remember that certain stuff is on sale
IT SHOULD BE IN THE SYSTEM
And labelled too!
That's the huge fucking joke
They send signs, they send sales planners
Oh
Then the fucking sale isn't even in the fucking system for ringing people out
Well
Umm
Excuse me a moment
:P
ponders on the nature of corporate idiocy
lets out a cry of frustration at the nature of corporate idiocy
Seriously, what the blazes?
Tbh, it doesn't make it any less frustrating when it takes a week for the sale to finally register
Because that's happened.  A week after sales are in effect, they suddenly start ringing up
Whaaaat
Here's why I'm frustrated
A short list of specials I need to remember so customers don't get pissed (and the chain has been on the decline for years)
store brand gallon teas / lemonades, 2 for $5.  They ring up individually as $3.49
coke / 7up 20oz bottles, 2 for $3.33, ring up individually at $1.99
pepsi 20oz 2 for $3.49
King size reeses holiday pb cups, 2 for $3
Wheesh
hershey king size candy, 2 for $3.50
And those are the ones I bother to remember for now
Bit pricey all that
And that's sale
Know what, typing all this out... fuck the place, I'm requesting 3 days max xD
And you have to remember all of those?
Wheesh.
I do it as a courtesy for the customers
So how goes a search for alternative careers?
I actually give a flying fuck, and get irritated when I realize something's on sale and I overcharged someone
That's a good trait to have for a cashier
Honest
If I DO forget, sometimes they point it out
And you're still treated like rubbish by Corporate.
Figures...
I can tell you why the chain is on the decline, doesn't matter what corporation owns the chain, they probably don't have their shit together :/
I'm hoping my 2nd job starts giving me consistent hours
Yeah.
Money is basically the only reason I'm sticking around, and I think I could squeeze by working only 20 - 24 hours there
I work 8 hour shifts at €10.00 an hour. Double on Sundays when I work then.
All my shifts are 12:00 midday to 8:00pm
The starting wage at the place is $9.50 an hour.  Turns out that the new company that bought the chain eliminated the $0.25 an hour raise after 3 months
So now raises are yearly only
I see.
And our schedules are a bit nonsensical due to the skimpy hours corporate gives the store
Jeepers.
All I know is that I start at 2 at the earliest, and stay until 11 at the latest
That's a hefty shift.
All over the place...
Aside from manning the store completely alone for 1.5 - 2.5 hours, I definitely prefer the later shifts
I spend the last two hours of my shift alone finishing washing the dishes.
If I'm ever on shift when the store gets robbed, they can find themselves a new cashier, haha
Because I can guarantee it's gonna be in that window where I'm there alone
Because, believe it or not, despite the gas station being in a relatively low crime area, and being literally 3 minutes from a police station, it's been robbed twice in the past few years
That's bad...
And if they were armed, it'd definitely be a rush out
Unless you had something to stop 'em...
Yeah, no, completely open checkout.  employees can easily walk behind and out from the checkout
Shoot
Other stores have had major robbery issues
I'd say go for the nadgers, but I know that most robberies in the US are armed...
And it'd be hard to go for the nadgers when the target has a gun
Mostly because our stores are small and don't have many employees at a given moment
Oof
On the bright side, if I get shot, I'm pretty sure I could find some money-hungry lawyer to help me sue the chain for medical expenses / putting me in harms way ;)
My parents often joke about how much the US has in terms of Suing...
The court system can more or less be broken up into 2 sides
Criminal, and civil
Criminal is where they pursue legal punishment, civil is for damages
I see.
So Judge Judy would be Civil court
Yes
Because she often handles lawsuits and stuff
I guess I do have one final complaint
There's almost never a manager, in any capacity, on second shift
You know, someone who can make calls on what to do in unusual situations that lowly cashiers like me don't really have the authority to make
Also, glad to have this chat with you, definitely requesting 3 days at most today xD
That's dog dinner
That's ok
Dog dinner?  I have never heard this phrase and would like to know more :D
"Try not to make a dog's dinner of this"
That sorta phrase
HAHAHA, google does not disappoint
Dog dinner synonym's: clusterfuck
XD
The closest we have is one of my coworkers, who his shift supervisor, but he's working roughly the same amount that I want to go down to
And even then, he needs to call managers just like the rest of us in weird situations
Ideally there should be a manager on almost all of the time
Or at least you should be able to do some of the things you need to without one.
It's a bit difficult, given that the station is open 24/7, but given that they only want a single person on shift at night, and they might get 10 people at most, it's not unreasonable
But yeah... I can only describe this job as suitable for someone who needs the cash (me, somewhat), or wants to kill time
Also, I was much happier those few weeks where I was only scheduled for 3 days.  But that's enough ranting about the job :P
True
So
Anything cool happen lately?
